verses.verse: (God’s Mighty Deeds Recalled) To the leader: according to Jeduthun. Of Asaph. A Psalm. (Ps 3.4) I cry aloud to God, aloud to God, that he may hear me.
(Ps 50.15; Isa 26.9, 16) In the day of my trouble I seek the Lord; in the night my hand is stretched out without wearying; my soul refuses to be comforted.
(Ps 142.3; 143.4) I think of God, and I moan; I meditate, and my spirit faints. Selah
You keep my eyelids from closing; I am so troubled that I cannot speak.
(Deut 32.7; Isa 51.9) I consider the days of old and remember the years of long ago.
(Ps 4.4; 42.8) I commune (Gk Syr: Heb My music) with my heart in the night; I meditate and search my spirit: (Syr Jerome: Heb my spirit searches)
(Ps 74.1; 85.1) “Will the Lord spurn forever and never again be favorable?
(Ps 89.49; 2 Pet 3.9) Has his steadfast love ceased forever? Are his promises at an end for all time?
(Ps 25.6; Isa 49.15) Has God forgotten to be gracious? Has he in anger shut up his compassion?” Selah
(Ps 31.22; 44.2, 3) And I say, “It is my grief that the right hand of the Most High has changed.”
(Ps 143.5) I will call to mind the deeds of the LORD; I will remember your wonders of old.
I will meditate on all your work and muse on your mighty deeds.
(Ex 15.11; Ps 73.17) Your way, O God, is holy. What god is so great as our God?
You are the God who works wonders; you have displayed your might among the peoples.
(Ex 6.6; Deut 9.29) With your strong arm you redeemed your people, the descendants of Jacob and Joseph. Selah
(Ex 14.21) When the waters saw you, O God, when the waters saw you, they were afraid; the very deep trembled.
(Judg 5.4; 2 Sam 22.15) The clouds poured out water; the skies thundered; your arrows flashed on every side.
(2 Sam 22.8) The crash of your thunder was in the whirlwind; your lightnings lit up the world; the earth trembled and shook.
(Ex 14.28; Hab 3.15) Your way was through the sea, your path through the mighty waters, yet your footprints were unseen.
(Ex 6.26; 13.21; Isa 63.11-13) You led your people like a flock by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
